page.title: Battle of the Gulf of Almería (1591)

revision.text:
{{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of the Gulf of Almería (1591) |partof=the [[Eighty Years' War]] and the [[Anglo–Spanish War (1585)|Anglo–Spanish War (1585–1604)]] |image=[[File:Arrecife de las Sirenas 2 - Almería (2569433323).jpg|300px]] |caption=Photography of the [[Almería|Gulf of Almería]] by [http://www.flickr.com/people/9902638@N06 Gabriel Villena]. |date=Late August, 1591 |place=[[Almería|Gulf of Almería]], [[Mediterranean Sea]] |result=Spanish victory[[Cesáreo Fernández Duro|Fernández Duro, Cesáreo]] (1898). ''Armada Española desde la unión de los reinos de Castilla y Aragón.'' Vol. III. Instituto de Historia y Cultura Naval. [http://www.armada.mde.es/html/historiaarmada/tomo3/tomo_03_05.pdf p.78]VV.AA. ''Enciclopedia General del Mar''. (1957) |combatant1={{flagicon|Dutch Republic}} [[Dutch Republic|United Provinces]]
{{flagcountry|Kingdom of England}} |combatant2={{flag|Spain|1506}} |commander1=Unknown |commander2={{flagicon|Spain|1506}} [[Martín de Padilla y Manrique, 1st Count of Santa Gadea|Martín de Padilla]] |strength1=Unknown: 35 ships |strength2=Unknown: 20 ships |casualties1=20 Dutch ships captured[[Cesáreo Fernández Duro|Fernández Duro, Cesáreo]] (1898) p.78
3 English ships captured |casualties2=Light |}} {{Campaignbox Anglo-Spanish War}} {{Campaignbox Eighty Years' War}} The '''Battle of the Gulf of Almería''', also known as the '''Battle of Almería Bay''' or the '''Battle of Cape of Palos''', was a naval Spanish victory that took place in late August, 1591, off [[Almería]], near the [[Cape Palos]], during the [[Eighty Years' War]] and the [[Anglo–Spanish War (1585)|Anglo–Spanish War (1585–1604)]]. The battle occurred when the Spanish fleet of the ''[[Adelantado|Adelantado of Castile]]'', Don [[Martín de Padilla y Manrique, 1st Count of Santa Gadea|Martín de Padilla y Manrique, Count of Santa Gadea]] (in their return from the [[Republic of Venice]] to [[Spain]] with a valuable goods), sighted an Anglo-Dutch fleet in the waters of Almería, in the southern coast of Spain. The Spanish fleet, led by Martín de Padilla, attacked with such fury the Anglo-Dutch fleet who managed to undo their training, achieving a great success. About 20 Dutch ships and 3 English ships were captured by the Spaniards, and some ships of the rest of the Anglo-Dutch fleet were seriously damaged. On the other hand, the Spanish losses were minimal. After the battle, the Spanish fleet victorious, entered the port of Almeria with the captured ships. ==See also== * [[Cape Palos]] * [[Siege of Deventer (1591)]] * [[Battle of Flores (1591)]] * [[Siege of Rouen (1591)]] * [[Battle of the Bay of Biscay (1592)]] ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== * [[Cesáreo Fernández Duro|Fernández Duro, Cesáreo]] (1898). ''Armada Española desde la unión de los reinos de Castilla y Aragón.'' Vol. III. Instituto de Historia y Cultura Naval. Madrid. {{es icon}} * VV.AA. ''Enciclopedia General del Mar''. Garriga. (1957). * Rodríguez González, Agustín Ramón. ''Victorias por Mar de los Españoles''. Grafite Ediciones (2006). ISBN 978-84-96281-38-7 {{es icon}} * MacCaffrey, Wallace T. (1994). ''Elizabeth I: War and Politics, 1588-1603''. Princeton. Princeton University Press. USA. ISBN 978-0-691-03651-9 ==External links== * [[Cesáreo Fernández Duro|Fernández Duro, Cesáreo]] (1898). [http://www.armada.mde.es/html/historiaarmada/tomo3/tomo_03_05.pdf ''Armada Española desde la unión de los reinos de Castilla y Aragón.''] Vol. III. Instituto de Historia y Cultura Naval. Madrid. {{es icon}} * [http://www.todoavante.es/index.php?title=Manrique_de_Lara_y_Padilla,_Mart%C3%ADn Biografía de Don Martín Manrique de Lara y Padilla, Adelantado Mayor de Castilla] {{es icon}} {{coord missing}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gulf of Almeria, Battle of the 1591}} [[Category:Naval battles of the Eighty Years' War]] [[Category:Naval battles of the Anglo-Spanish War (1585–1604)]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1591]] [[Category:Naval battles involving Spain]] [[Category:Naval battles involving the Dutch Republic]] [[Category:Naval battles involving England]] [[Category:1591 in Europe]] [[Category:1591 in the British Empire]] [[Category:1591 in Spain]]
